Docs.summary: Represents an individual item within a or ASP.NET mobile control. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Although the class name is <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem>, the element name is `Item`. On a mobile page, you declare an item by using the [\<Item>](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/7152e195-e1d6-4a91-9dba-e0536a676e79) element.
## Examples The following code example shows how you manipulate items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem> object through the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItemCollection> class by using the selected item's index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.SelectionList.Items%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.
[!code-aspx-csharp[MobileListItemSample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileListItemSample/cs/Default.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[MobileListItemSample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileListItemSample/vb/Default.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Text { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Text : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the text contained in the item. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The text in the item. The default is an empty string ("").

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> property is an empty string or is never set, either programmatically or through the constructor, it returns the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Value%2A> property for the specified list item.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> property can be specified by using the `Text` attribute, or as inner text. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> property is specified in both ways, the inner text always takes precedence. However, if the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobileListItem.Text%2A> property is programmatically set, the inner text is automatically removed and the newly set property takes precedence.
